title.narrative: Improving production and expanding the market for the 'Mt Kenya coffee' brand.

description.narrative:
MCCCU is a cooperative union formed by 34 primary societies all producing coffee that have in total 76,000 active members and more than 120,000 registered members. The union has different business units that contribute to its income streams. However, being a coffee union part of its mandate is to support its members (PCs) but moreso the individual farmers to produce more coffee and thus increase their income. This project therefore seeks to strengthen MCCCU's resolve of helping its members through trainings, inputs, advises and advances among others for them to improve on the quality and quantity of coffee in their farms. In 2017, the union's members recorded an average production increase of 19% comparared to the previous year due to the deliberate interventions measures targeting the farmers. It is expected, that in the coming 2 years, productivity of coffee from the members will further increase with the same growth rate of about 20%. On the marketing side, MCCCU made steps to increase their influence at the local market consumption segment in Kenya by carrying out comprehensive marketing survey and documenting a marketing plan. The results of these initiatatives are expected to be realized in 2018, the goal being to sell upto 30 bags of grounded and packaged coffee every month in 2018.
Project Activities Improve the brand 'Mt Kenya Meru Arabica Coffee' through the redesign of the packages and promotional materials. Produce new Branding materials Undertake promotional activities such as wet tasting in Supermarkets, Merchandisers, promoters, Gondolas et al. Re-design the website to suit the newly developed branding materials. Train all the markting and sales staff on coffee production and quality Organise a coffee Festival/Field day for all the coffee farmers in Meru County Kick-off Event on status of governance and Financial management Including both the Governance health check and the financial management health check. Analysis of the audited financial statements for the past 3 years and training the board and management on how to analyse them, including the cashflow forecasts and KPI dashboard Retrain the 34 TOTs on crop husbandry, soil analysis interpration and cherry picking to enhance quality. Also, meet all of them to take stock of 2017 Services Event: Training Supervisory board training Basic Financial management training FACT follow-up workshop
Increase coffee production by upto 20% in 2018 Grow the market share for the Mt Kenya coffee Strengthen governance and financial management in MCCCU
